products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-ocp-ai
products.label: [Add-ons Beta] Cloud automation for Red Hat OpenShift AI
products.short_description: Deploy Red Hat OpenShift cluster on Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) pre-configured with AI capabilities for accelerated machine learning workloads.
products.long_description: This automation streamlines the deployment of Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on. It accelerates the setup of machine learning environments by leveraging the capabilities of the OpenShift AI add-on with GPU-enabled clusters, reducing the complexity of AI infrastructure management and allowing data scientists and developers to focus on model development and deployment. Learn more about [Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-getting-started) and the [OpenShift AI add-on](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-ai-addon-about). Refer [here](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/containers?topic=containers-supported-cluster-addon-versions#openshift-ai-416) for the supported OpenShift AI add-on versions.

features.title: Provision Red Hat OpenShift cluster
features.description: Creates and configures a GPU-enabled Red Hat OpenShift cluster on a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) to enable the installation of the OpenShift AI Add-on for integrating advanced artificial intelligence capabilities. [Learn more.](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-ocp-vpc-1728a4fd-f561-4cf9-82ef-2b1eeb5da1a8-global)

features.title: Red Hat OpenShift AI Add-on
features.description: Automates the provisioning of a fully configured Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on. This includes optimized configurations for machine learning frameworks and simplified deployment of AI-driven applications. Refer [here](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-ai-addon-install&interface=ui) to learn the service and its capabilities.

features.title: Optional Integrations
features.description: Optional dependencies that can be integrated include [Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-vpc-2af61763-f8ef-4527-a815-b92166f29bc8-global), [Cloud Object Storage (COS)](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cos-68921490-2778-4930-ac6d-bae7be6cd958-global), [Secrets Manager (SM)](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/testing-deploy-arch-ibm-secrets-manager-5f149ae6-d781-460a-977d-c8c4171ad0fa-global), [Observability](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-observability-a3137d28-79e0-479d-8a24-758ebd5a0eab-global), [Key Management Services (KMS)](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/testing-deploy-arch-ibm-kms-85fdbd7a-8c77-4abd-b716-653a31f3aba9-global) and [Account Configuration](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-account-infra-base-63641cec-6093-4b4f-b7b0-98d2f4185cd6-global).

diagram.caption: Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on

diagrams.description:
This architecture illustrates the deployment of GPU enabled Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on, showcasing the key and optional components their interactions for AI workload support.The deployment leverages [Red Hat OpenShift cluster](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-cluster-create-vpc-gen2&interface=ui) Deployable Architecture , which is required to create and configure the cluster and in this cluster, we will install the OpenShift AI add-on.
Optional resources are :

- A [Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-getting-started&interface=ui) Deployable Architecture can be enabled to deploy the OpenShift AI cluster in a secure and isolated network environment. Users have the flexibility to either create a new VPC or use an existing one for the cluster deployment.
- Integrating [Cloud Object Storage (COS)](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-getting-started-cloud-object-storage) allows OpenShift AI workloads to efficiently manage large datasets and store logs.
- [Account Configuration](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/account) Deployable Architecture supports the creation and configuration of the foundational components of an IBM Cloud account.
- Enabling Observability resources in OpenShift AI adds capabilities for [logging](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-logs?topic=cloud-logs-instance-launch), [monitoring](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-launch), and [activity tracker event routing](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/atracker?topic=atracker-getting-started)â€”to enhance visibility and operational insights.
- A Key Management Services (KMS) configuring key rings and keys for encryption.If kms_encryption enabled either [Hyper protect services](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/hs-crypto?topic=hs-crypto-get-started) or [Key Protect](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/key-protect?topic=key-protect-getting-started-tutorial)used for encryption.
- Enabling [Secrets Manager (SM)](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-getting-started) stores and manages service credential.
